libertybill 159722350132 "2017-04-18 17:46:31 GMT" https://libertybill.tumblr.com/post/159722350132/5-bad-arguments-for-public-infrastructure-spending "catoinstitute: Good infrastructure
column5: can certainly improve economic mobility and lower costs by reducing travel time between locations. This
column7: says nothing about the kinds of institutions most likely to produce good infrastructure or who should fund it‚Ä¶.With healthcare reform stalling
column8: President Trump‚Äôs administration seems ready to shift focus onto infrastructure. Here‚Äôs a handy guide to some of the bad economic reasoning you will likely hear as the debate about infrastructure spending heats up.Past benefits don‚Äôt mean future benefits.¬†Highway construction can substantially boost productivity for industries associated with road use
column9: but those benefits are largely one-offs. Too many new highways were built between 1983 and 2003
column10: and marginal extensions to the highway system are unlikely to increase social welfare because the cost savings from reduced travel times are relatively small. We should judge new projects on their own merits
column11: not against old examples or countries in different circumstances.Don‚Äôt ignore opportunity costs.¬†As legislation for infrastructure is pushed
column12: we will hear plenty about the costs of delays to the economy. These costs are undoubtedly very real
column13: but so are the costs of building new infrastructure
column14: and that money can‚Äôt then be spent on other things that we might have preferred to spend them on.¬†But what about that one bridge‚Ä¶?¬†Individual catastrophic events can lead to concern about the physical conditions of infrastructure. You often hear that 58
column18: according to the Federal Highways Agency
column19: ‚Äústructurally deficient does not mean that it is likely to collapse or that it is unsafe.‚Äù The proportion of bridges labeled structurally deficient has also fallen from 24.1% in 1990 to 9.6% in 2015.‚ÄùCheap debt doesn‚Äôt make everything a bargain.¬†If there are structural reasons why demand for transportation use is falling
column20: then any investment would yield far fewer economic benefits. Infrastructure decisions should be judged by robust estimates of costs and expected benefits
column21: not just how cheap it is to borrow.How stimulus actually works‚Ä¶¬†Two well-known arguments for infrastructure investment are 1) that government investment spending can be used to ‚Äústimulate‚Äù the economy and put people back to work.
column23: efficient investments can help enhance long-term productivity growth. These two ambitions often conflict. Attempts to stimulate quickly and get people back to work will likely result in sloppy project selection and the hiring of more labor than would be most efficient. And
column24: infrastructure funds will likely go preferentially to the well-connected.Learn More‚Ä¶" False text

column3: injuring him and killing his dog
column4: authorities and relatives said on Friday. Canyon Mansfield
column6: was playing with his yellow Labrador retriever
column8: on Thursday afternoon near his home east of Pocatello when he saw what he thought was a sprinkler head on the ground and touched the device
column9: causing it to detonate. The explosion sprayed the boy and his 3-year-old
column10: 90-pound (40 kg) pet with toxic cyanide gas
column12: Theresa Mansfield. ‚ÄúCanyon said there was a bang like a bomb
column13: then an explosion of an orange substance that covered him and Casey

column17: rushed to the scene and pounded on the dog‚Äôs chest in a futile effort to revive the animal. The family and first-responders underwent decontamination procedures and the boy

column20: officials and family members said. The device
